quotation_to_use_keyword: We integrate AI-driven analytics to provide actionable insights and automate routine tasks.
research_objectives: To analyze the development, market positioning, user engagement, and competitive strategies of a tech startup in the project management software industry, emphasizing innovation through AI integration.
theoretical_framework: Innovation Diffusion Theory, Technology Acceptance Model

chunk.original_content: But it’s only really to fill any gaps. When we have extreme heat, or anything like that, we just fill in gaps when there’s surplus, things like that.

When you say that, do you mean the farm side or the [org name] ? I think the [org name]. [org name] is 3 farmers, we all grow potatoes. We are all selling individually, and what we’re trying to do is come together to make an organisation basically, where all our potatoes are bought centrally and marketed all together. So, fundamentally, we brought in a trader to take the burden out of the individual farms and get closer to the customers, because the customers don’t really want to deal with the farms, they would rather go through an organisation. So, it’s like an interface between the farmers and the customers? Yes, basically, somewhere in the middle it’s owned by the farmers. Set up for the farmers.
The small outlets like farm shops, places like that, they often have online sales, the veg boxes – that side of things has done very well on the back of it.

We want more growers on board, more customers, and to grow that base we’d need to add more of what we’re doing and probably streamline what we’re doing. So, there’s a three-way approach where we can drive out the inefficiencies, really. And another thing, well as you know, things have changed quite recently – can you see any trends in society that could perhaps accelerate the vision that you’ve just put forward, that might contribute to help?
